title.rendered: Gulf vs Emirates, International League, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Gulf: Tom Banton (wk), James Vince (c), Chris Lynn, Rehan Ahmed, Shimron Hetmyer, David Wiese, Liam Dawson, Aayan Afzal Khan, Chris Jordan, Sanchit Sharma, Richard Gleeson

Emirates: Muhammad Waseem, Andre Fletcher, Lorcan Tucker (wk), Kieron Pollard (c), Najibullah Zadran, Dan Mousley, Dwayne Bravo, Trent Boult, Imran Tahir, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Zahoor Khan

Venue: Sheikh Zayed Stadium, Abu Dhabi

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 180

2nd innings average score: 194

Wickets per innings: 5

Type: Good batting wicket

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

With three half-centuries in a row, Kieron Pollard is the biggest power player from Emirates. At Abu Dhabi, he has accumulated 206 runs at 103 including the highest score of 86.

Andre Fletcher is the only batter from Emirates to feature in the Ultimate Team in his last 5 games. Incidentally, his highest score (53) of the edition has come at Sheikh Zayed.

After registering 3 half-centuries in a row, James Vince has slightly gone off the boil. However, his selection percentage hasn’t dropped below 88 for the last 4 games.

As many as 9 fifties have been slammed in the last 3 games at Abu Dhabi.

In the same period, an average of 9 sixes have also been launched at the venue.

There has been only one three-wicket haul in this phase, and it belongs to Adam Zampa.
